result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court orders deft. to comply with DJA and Oconto  County VIP for one year.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody A. Pratt

defendant.name: Pratt, Cody A.
defendant.address: 7792 County Road I #47, Oconto Falls, WI 54154

records.addlTxt:
10:00 AM Defendant Cody A. Pratt in court.  Attorney Edward Daniel Burke Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bradley J. Schraven in court for Cody A. Pratt. Complaint reviewed.  NC plea entered to count 1. Plea and waiver questionnaire reviewed.  Plea made freely and voluntarily.  Court finds the deft. guilty and withholds sentence pursuant to DJA. Placed on VIP  for one year, conditions include Anger Management and follow through, AODA assessment and follow through.
Review scheduled for April 28, 2023 at 07:30 am.

Verification Form Victim's Contact w/Rainbow House

w/condition  Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages.  Defendant shall not possess/consume any illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia/controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  Defendant shall have no violent or abusive contact with alleged victim.  Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact w/MRT for 24 hours.  If victim submits paperwork from Rainbow House following protocol, Judge would lift 24 hour contact.  Defendant shall immediately report to the Sheriff's Department for fingerprinting and photographing.

11:30 AM Defendant Cody A. Pratt in court with attorney Jon G Spansail, SPD, for bond.  Deft. qualifies for SPD.  Defendant Cody A. Pratt in custody.  Edward Daniel Burke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cody A. Pratt appeared by video means with Attorney.    Def given complaint, advised of charges, and advised of right to counsel/SPD.  Victim present MRT and makes stmt.  Bond is set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
